question.body: A skeletal muscle fiber has a resting membrane potential that must be depolarized before an impulse can begin and cause a muscle twitch. This means there is a threshold stimulus that must be reached for the fiber to contract. Use this information to pick the most accurate statement from below.

multiple_choice.choice: The “All or Nothing” Theory of muscle contraction states: If the muscle fiber reaches the threshold stimulus of +30mV then the muscle fiber will be in summation and can enter tetanus.

The “All or Nothing” Theory of muscle contraction states: If the threshold stimulus of + 30mV is not reached no part of the fiber will contract; once the threshold stimulus of+30mV is reached the whole muscle fiber will contract.
The “All or Nothing” Theory of muscle contraction states: None of the muscle will contract until the threshold stimulus of +30mV is reached. Once it is reached the muscle fiber will enter tetanus.
The “All or Nothing” Theory of muscle contraction states: Once one muscle fiber reaches the threshold stimulus of 30mV the entire muscle will automatically contract.

response.feedback: Incorrect. In order to reach tetanus the muscle has to be stimulated multiple times and maintain a sustained contraction.
Correct. Once the threshold is reached the entire fiber will contract.
Incorrect. In order to reach tetanus the muscle has to be stimulated multiple times and maintain a sustained contraction.
Incorrect. A muscle (organ) consists of multiple muscle fibers that each need to be stimulated.
